prs.title: 🚀 Version packages
prs.truncated_body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @layerzerolabs/hyperliquid-composer@0.0.7

### Patch

prs.title: 🧹hyperliquid sdk improvement
prs.truncated_body:
Adding 2 new commands

1. Retrieve hip-1 token information
```bash
npx @layerzerolabs/hyperliquid-composer hip-token   \
    --token-index <coreIndex> \
    --network {testnet | mainnet} \
    [--log-level {info | verbose}]
```
This contains information about the deployment that isn't in the `npx @layerzerolabs/hyperliquid-composer core-spot` command such as deploy time, genesis amounts,

commits.message:
chore: get hip-1 token information

Signed-off-by: shankar <shankar@layerzerolabs.org>

chore: type conversion for asset bridge address

prs.title: core, graph, store: Pause failed subgraphs instead of unassigning
prs.truncated_body: Unassigning subgraphs has a number of unwanted side-effects, e.g., canceling copies. Pausing is safer alternative to avoid spending cycles on a subgraph we know will not make progress.

commits.message:
core, graph, store: Pause failed subgraphs instead of unassigning

Unassigning subgraphs has a number of unwanted side-effects, e.g.,
canceling copies. Pausing is safer alternative to avoid spending cycles on
a subgraph we know will not make progress.

prs.title: Added team slug flag in publish registry
prs.truncated_body:
As per the update on substreams.dev where we now handle organization publishing packages, the CLI command to publish now includes a flag (`-t` or `--team`) to add the team slug to publish.

If user is not in the organization, the call fails
If publish does not specific the team for a package that is published by a team, the call fails
If user adds the team flag on an update, the package is upd

commits.message: added team slug on registry publish

prs.title: op-batcher: support throttling additional endpoints (e.g. builders participating in a rollup-boost setup)
prs.truncated_body:
Replaces #14859 

Changes the batcher behavior to always throttle all sequencer EL endpoints, plus any additional endpoints specified by a new CLI flag. Throttling is performed on each endpoint concurrently and mostly independently. 

For context, see this design doc https://github.com/worldcoin/rollup-boost/blob/rollup-boost-ha/docs/rollup-boost-ha.md. 

TODO
- [x] still an open question a

commits.message: add throttling support for ha sequencer with rollup boost enabled
rewrite the logic to individually throttle each endpoint
do throttling endpoints fallback in batcherService init

shorten test by using a subtest template

don't need to test individual fn separately, it's covered by the cases which integrate multiple endpoints
update readme to reflect multiple sequencer throttling

remove shadowed ThrottlingEndpoints field in BatcherService

this was essentially overwriting the values with an empty list
extend test to cope with invalid (or unavailable) endpoint
be a little less insistent with test assertions
use more robust waiting mechanism in test
rename ThrottlingEndpoints to AdditionalThrottlingEndpoints and merge with L2EthRpc (now a StringSlice) on init

limit number of finalized and rewarded blocks (#745)

needed to limit unbounded block processing times in case of finality
stalling

prs.title: fix: ensure active fps have signing info after proposal
prs.truncated_body:
It is possible that some inactive fps become active after executing the finality resumption proposal. However, current implementation does not initiate signing info for those fps, which would cause panicking when handling liveness.

This PR fixed the issue by ensuring every active finality provider has signing info in the finality resumption proposal.

commits.message: ensure active fps have signing info after proposal
chore: add driver test for resume finality proposal of inactive fp
chore: modify logic of signing checker to avoid error equal
chore: update handle resume fp prop to also properly send events on the voting power distribution cache

Opening as draft to gather feedback on APIs, here are the main changes:

- rename `openOrder` to `sendOrderTransaction` to be able to use `openOrder` for a higher-level flow
- add `waitForOrderOpen(): Promise<ResolvedOrder>` to watch for the order `open` event given the transaction hash returned by `sendOrderTransaction`
- new `openOrder` function implementing the `validateOrder` + `sendOrderT

prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

We want to alert on this log message


## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes
- [ ] Added new tests
- [ ] Manually tested the code

<!-- Describe the steps you've taken to verify the changes -->

prs.title: feat(fortuna): Improve startup flow
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

- Each chain is started separately
- Run block timestamp tracking only if chain is registered
- Run hash generation in a blocking thread so that tokio can continue async operations
- Retry chain startup on failure

## Rationale

These changes improve the reliability of running fortuna in production.

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes
- [ ]

commits.message: fix(fortuna): Do not wait for all chains setup in startup
Use blocking thread for calculating hashchain
Put block timestamp lag next to other tracking tasks

prs.title: Fix headings in WIPO blog post
Add WIPO blog post
Upgrade actions/upload-artifact github action to v4
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Upgrade GitHub actions/upload-artifact from v3 to v4 in the publish workflow.

### Why
v3 has completely stopped working and failed part of the last v22.2.0 release.

prs.title: Disable LTX cache when BucketList is in memory
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This change disables the LTX cache when all BucketList state is in memory. This cache is not useful, since the load time of in-memory BucketList entries is similar to loading from the random eviction cache, and incurs significant overhead at high TPS. 

# Checklist
- [x] Reviewed the [contributing](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-c

commits.message: Disable ltx cache when all state is in memory

prs.title: Fix: flaky `net::tests::convergence` tests
prs.truncated_body:
### Description
~~If my read of these tests is correct, we are just looking for convergence, and these tests should not be testing the pruning of neighbors, so it is best to set these soft max values to be the same as the total number of peers to avoid any non-deterministic pruning. The pruning should be tested elsewhere.~~ See later comments and fixes.

### Applicable issues

- fixes #5761

This was another cause of flakiness in `net::tests::convergence` tests.

prs.title: Pretty print logged durations in E2E
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

It seems that by default, durations are encoded with their unixnano time. ref: https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/actions/runs/14783344371/job/41506889431?pr=3560#step:4:882

## How this works

Explicitly specifies human readable times.

## How this was tested

- [x] Inspect CI logs

## Need to be documented in RELEASES.md?

No

commits.message: Pretty print logged durations in E2E

prs.title: Update wallet to report tx processing duration via event handlers
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

A near-term goal is deploying a service that continuously submits transactions to fuji (and eventually mainnet) and measures the duration of issuance and confirmation. This PR updates the wallet in support of this eventual service. 

## How this works

Updates the primary chain wallets to compute the duration of issuance and confirmation and supplies those durat

prs.title: Refactor cache implementations
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

The `cache` package is currently a bit odd - as there is a `metercacher` sub-package (similar to the `database` implementations). But `lru` is implemented in the top level `cache` package.

This moves the `lru` implementations out of the `cache` package into their own package (to align with the database structure)

## How this works

- Moves code around
- Dep

commits.message: Merge branch 'refactor-cache-implementations' of github.com:ava-labs/avalanchego into refactor-cache-implementations

prs.title: Document ACP-77 handling of 0 weight requests
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

There was some confusion of how `message.L1ValidatorWeight` messages with `Weight=0` were supposed to be handled. 

Because the P-chain prunes all information about validators that have been removed (by setting `Weight=0`), there is nothing on disk to use to verify these messages.

To handle this, the caller is expected to provide a proof that the validator was

commits.message: Document acp-77 handling of 0 weight requests

prs.title: Document acp-118 message verification
prs.truncated_body:

There was some confusion around if `acp118.Verifier` was expected to validate the `NetworkID` and `SourceChainID` fields in the message. This documents that this verification is not expected.

Adds a couple comments.

prs.title: Ensure HTTP headers are propagated through the rpcchainvm
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Factored out of https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/pull/3294

## How this works

Introduces a rpc to sync the headers from the plugin vm. Our current implementation does not work because the headers is just a map/not an interface, so any modifications to the map are not synced across avalanchego <-> the plugin.

## How this was tested

Added a regressio

prs.title: Allow MS calls to be subsidized.
prs.truncated_body:
## changelog

### new features

- Allow MultiSig calls to be subsidized.  The MS needs to remove it's `PayingDID` after accepting the subsidy authorization, otherwise transaction fees would still be paid by the primary key of the `PayingDID`.

commits.message: Allow MS calls to be subsidized.
Fix issue with rust integration tests.  The MS subsidy feature only works for the current release.
Add another test for MS payer subsidy.
